alert.note: Alert for Clinch; Echols; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Southern Ware; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 5:47PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN BAKER...COLUMBIA... SUWANNEE...HAMILTON...EASTERN ECHOLS...SOUTHERN WARE...CLINCH AND NORTHWESTERN CHARLTON COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 547 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Argyle to 6 miles west of Live Oak. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, excessive cloud-to-ground lightning, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake City, Live Oak, Jasper, White Springs, Fargo, Argyle, Ichetucknee Spring, Suwannee Springs, Stephen Foster State Park, and Columbia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Clinch; Echols; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Southern Ware; Western Charlton
